geninfo.para: 9200, 9300 and 9400 Models built after October 1, 1996, with International air and spring suspensions will be available with long-stroke brake chambers on Rockwell, Haldex and Eaton slack adjusters. Long-stroke brake chambers will not be available with Bendix or Gunite slack adjusters.

Front long-stroke service brake chambers will be offered as a non-serviceable part. The rear service brake chamber, as well as the combination service/spring brake chamber, will have serviceable service brake diaphragms. The spring side of the combination service/spring brake chamber will remain non-serviceable as with current product.

The long-stroke chambers will have a welded-on clevis in lieu of the current screw-on clevis. This eliminates initial brake adjustment set-up procedures during service and in-service which insures correct initial brake set-up.
MGM will provide the long-stroke brake chamber to Navistar.
Two new standard brake codes have been established for long-stroke brake chambers:
S-Cam; 15x4; includes MGM 20 sq. in. long-stroke brake chambers.
S-Cam; 16.5x7; includes Mgm 30 sq. in. long-stroke spring actuated parking brake chamber.
